neighborhoods.name: La Croisette
neighborhoods.character: The glamorous heart of Cannes, featuring luxury hotels, designer boutiques, and the famous palm-lined promenade along the Mediterranean coast.

location.description: Located along the Mediterranean coast, stretching from the Palais des Festivals to the eastern edge of Cannes.
landmarks: Palais des Festivals et des Congrès

history.overview: Developed in the 19th century as a luxury resort area, La Croisette became the symbol of Cannes' glamorous reputation.
history.significance: Home to the Cannes Film Festival and the most prestigious hotels and boutiques on the French Riviera.
notable_events: Development of luxury hotels in the 1920s

transit: Central bus stops along the boulevard
Walking distance to Palais des Festivals
practical_info.safety: Very safe with constant foot traffic and security presence.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Evening for glamorous atmosphere, morning for shopping, sunset for promenade walks.
practical_info.walkability: Excellent with wide pedestrian promenade and flat terrain.

attractions.name: Palais des Festivals
attractions.description: Iconic venue of the Cannes Film Festival with famous red carpet steps.
attractions.appeal: Essential visit to walk the same steps as movie stars.

attractions.name: La Croisette Promenade
attractions.description: Famous palm-lined boulevard with luxury boutiques and Mediterranean views.
attractions.appeal: Perfect for people-watching and experiencing Cannes' glamour.

attractions.name: Plage de la Croisette
attractions.description: Main beach with both public areas and exclusive beach clubs.
attractions.appeal: Swimming, sunbathing, and luxury beach experiences.

activities.name: Red Carpet Walk
activities.description: Walk the famous red steps where movie stars make their entrance.

activities.name: Luxury Shopping
activities.description: Browse designer boutiques and luxury brands.

stay_here_if: You want to be at the heart of Cannes' glamour and luxury
You're attending the Film Festival or business events
You prefer luxury accommodations and high-end shopping
avoid_if: You want to avoid tourist crowds
insider_tips: Visit early morning to avoid crowds and get the best photos of the Palais.
Book beach club reservations well in advance during peak season.
The promenade is most magical during sunset hours.

neighborhoods.name: Le Suquet
neighborhoods.character: Cannes' charming historic quarter perched on a hill, featuring narrow cobblestone streets, authentic restaurants, and panoramic views over the bay.

location.description: Located on a hill overlooking the port and bay, connected to the modern city by steep streets and staircases.

history.overview: The original settlement of Cannes, dating back to Roman times, with medieval fortifications and traditional Provençal architecture.
history.significance: Historic heart of Cannes, preserving the authentic character before the luxury development of La Croisette.

practical_info.safety: Very safe with good lighting and regular foot traffic.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Afternoon for dining, evening for atmosphere, morning for peaceful exploration.
practical_info.walkability: Challenging due to steep hills and cobblestone streets, but very rewarding.

attractions.name: Musée de la Castre
attractions.description: Medieval castle housing diverse collections with spectacular tower views.
attractions.appeal: Best panoramic views of Cannes and the bay from the tower.

attractions.name: Église Notre-Dame de l'Espérance
attractions.description: 16th-century church with beautiful religious art and terrace views.
attractions.appeal: Historic religious site with stunning bay views.

attractions.name: Historic Streets
attractions.description: Narrow cobblestone streets with traditional Provençal buildings.

activities.name: Historic Walking Tour
activities.description: Explore the medieval streets and learn about Cannes' history.

activities.name: Sunset Photography
activities.description: Capture stunning sunset views over the bay from elevated positions.

stay_here_if: You want authentic local atmosphere and historic charm
You prefer walking to restaurants and cultural sites
You enjoy panoramic views and quiet evenings
avoid_if: You want easy access to luxury shopping
insider_tips: Wear comfortable shoes for the steep cobblestone streets.
Many restaurants don't take reservations - arrive early for dinner.
Best photos are taken during golden hour from the church terrace.

neighborhoods.name: Centre-ville
neighborhoods.character: The bustling commercial heart of Cannes, featuring shopping streets, markets, and a mix of local and tourist amenities.

location.description: Located between La Croisette and Le Suquet, centered around Rue d'Antibes and Marché Forville.

history.overview: Developed as the commercial and administrative center of Cannes, connecting the historic quarter with the luxury resort area.
history.significance: Practical heart of daily life in Cannes, serving both locals and visitors with essential services.

transit: Walking distance to all major areas
practical_info.safety: Very safe with constant activity and good lighting.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Morning for markets, afternoon for shopping, evening for dining.
practical_info.walkability: Excellent with pedestrian streets and flat terrain.

attractions.name: Marché Forville
attractions.description: Vibrant covered market with fresh produce, local specialties, and flowers.
attractions.appeal: Authentic taste of local life and fresh ingredients.

attractions.name: Rue d'Antibes
attractions.description: Main shopping street with mix of international brands and local boutiques.
attractions.appeal: More accessible shopping than La Croisette luxury boutiques.

attractions.name: Allées de la Liberté
attractions.description: Charming square with pétanque court and local atmosphere.

dining.name: Côté Jardin
dining.known_for: Garden terrace and fresh market ingredients

activities.name: Market Shopping
activities.description: Experience local life at the traditional Provençal market.

activities.name: Shopping Spree
activities.description: Browse shops ranging from local boutiques to international brands.

stay_here_if: You want convenient access to shopping and markets
You prefer practical amenities and local atmosphere
You want to be central but not in the luxury district
avoid_if: You want to avoid commercial activity
insider_tips: Visit the market early morning for best selection and fewer crowds.
Rue d'Antibes offers better value than La Croisette luxury boutiques.
Many restaurants offer better prices than waterfront dining.

neighborhoods.name: Port de Cannes
neighborhoods.character: The historic fishing port transformed into a modern marina, featuring waterfront restaurants, boat watching, and maritime atmosphere.

location.description: Located at the base of Le Suquet, extending along the waterfront with the marina and fishing port.

history.overview: Traditional fishing port that has evolved into a modern marina while maintaining its maritime character.
history.significance: Historic maritime heart of Cannes, connecting the city to the Mediterranean and islands.

practical_info.safety: Very safe with good lighting and regular maritime activity.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Evening for dining and sunset views, morning for market activity, afternoon for boat watching.
practical_info.walkability: Excellent with flat waterfront promenades and good paths.

attractions.name: Marina
attractions.description: Modern marina hosting luxury yachts and pleasure craft.
attractions.appeal: Perfect for yacht watching and maritime photography.

attractions.name: Fish Market
attractions.description: Daily fresh fish market where local fishermen sell their catch.
attractions.appeal: Authentic maritime culture and fresh seafood.

attractions.name: Waterfront Promenade
attractions.description: Scenic walkway along the harbor with views of boats and sea.
attractions.appeal: Ideal for evening strolls and photography.

activities.name: Island Ferry Trips
activities.description: Take ferries to Île Sainte-Marguerite and Île Saint-Honorat.

activities.name: Sunset Photography
activities.description: Capture stunning sunset views over the marina and boats.

stay_here_if: You love waterfront views and maritime atmosphere
You want easy access to island excursions
You prefer waterfront dining and boat watching
avoid_if: You want to avoid maritime activity
insider_tips: Book island ferry tickets in advance during peak season.
Waterfront restaurants fill up quickly at sunset - reserve ahead.
Early morning offers the best light for maritime photography.

neighborhoods.name: Quartier de la Californie
neighborhoods.character: An upscale residential neighborhood on the hills overlooking Cannes, featuring beautiful Belle Époque villas and panoramic views.

location.description: Located on the hills east of the center, offering elevated views over Cannes and the Mediterranean.

history.overview: Developed in the late 19th century as an exclusive residential area for wealthy visitors and residents.
history.significance: Represents the luxury residential development of Cannes during its golden age of tourism.

practical_info.safety: Very safe upscale residential area with good security.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Evening for sunset views, morning for clear vistas, any time for architecture appreciation.
practical_info.walkability: Challenging due to steep hills, but rewarding for views.

attractions.name: Belle Époque Villas
attractions.description: Collection of elegant 19th-century villas with period architectural details.
attractions.appeal: Perfect for architecture walks and photography.

attractions.name: Panoramic Viewpoints
attractions.description: Multiple elevated positions offering stunning views of Cannes and the coast.
attractions.appeal: Best panoramic views of the city and Mediterranean.

attractions.name: Private Gardens
attractions.description: Beautiful private gardens and landscaping around the villas.
attractions.appeal: Peaceful green spaces with Mediterranean plants.

activities.name: Architecture Walking Tour
activities.description: Explore the Belle Époque buildings and learn about their history.

activities.name: Panoramic Photography
activities.description: Capture sweeping views of Cannes, the coast, and surrounding landscape.

stay_here_if: You appreciate historic architecture and refined atmosphere
You want panoramic views and peaceful residential setting
avoid_if: You want to walk to restaurants and attractions
You prefer beachfront or city center locations
insider_tips: Best panoramic photos are taken during golden hour.
Some residential streets offer surprising viewpoints.
Access by car or taxi recommended due to steep terrain.

neighborhoods.name: La Bocca
neighborhoods.character: A more local and residential area west of central Cannes, offering authentic French Riviera atmosphere and beautiful beaches.

location.description: Located west of the center, extending toward the western edge of Cannes with access to beaches and residential areas.

history.overview: Developed as a residential extension of Cannes, maintaining more local character than the tourist center.
history.significance: Represents the authentic residential side of Cannes beyond the tourist areas.

practical_info.safety: Safe residential area with local community presence.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Morning for beach activities, afternoon for swimming, evening for local dining.
practical_info.walkability: Good for walking with flat terrain and beach access.

attractions.name: Plage de la Bocca
attractions.description: Long stretch of sandy beach popular with locals and families.
attractions.appeal: Less crowded than central beaches with authentic atmosphere.

attractions.name: Local Residential Areas
attractions.description: Authentic residential areas showing local French Riviera life.
attractions.appeal: Experience real local culture away from tourist areas.

attractions.name: Beach Clubs
attractions.description: Several beach clubs offering dining and water sports.
attractions.appeal: Organized beach activities and dining options.

activities.name: Beach Activities
activities.description: Swimming, sunbathing, and water sports at local beaches.

activities.name: Local Culture Experience
activities.description: Experience authentic local French Riviera life.

stay_here_if: You want authentic local atmosphere away from tourist crowds
You prefer beautiful beaches with local character
avoid_if: You want to walk to major attractions and shopping
insider_tips: Beach clubs offer day-use facilities and dining options.
Local restaurants offer better value than tourist areas.
Perfect area for families with children.
